Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Rate Limit OData requests" (#5854) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Expensive OData requests degrade significantly the performance of the Gallery and cause requests to fail.
Many of those requests are done by users who replicate nuget.org. 
This issue is about investigating the scenarios those OData queries are required for, introducing and documenting V3 solutions for them, and finally lowering our rate limits on those endpoints after a sufficient warning.
Current rate limits: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/nuget/api/rate-limits
Documentation on how to replicate usign V3: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/nuget/guides/api/query-for-all-published-packages

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Incoming Mails from Nuget / Github are marked as Spam" (#5190) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
I´m form IT and have to fixe a problem some of our sofware developer have.
Most Mail from Nuget are marked as spam in our Spamfilter. I can see that all mails from Nuget will be send over Server sendgrid.net.

I can see there three reasons.
1. Remotehost is listed in the following RBL lists: inps.de 167.89.100.17 o2.hv1nn.shared.sendgrid.net
2. MAIL FROM domain (sendgrid.net) and Header-From domain (nuget.org) are not equal.
3. CYREN IP reputation determined a medium risk associated with the sender address 167.89.100.17

Not all Mails have the same problem, but most.
I´m not able to put the Domain sendgrid.net to whitelist because of Reason 2

Who can help us?

THX              Balsfulland

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Allow for wildcard reservation of package names" (#103) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody: The RIA Services team would like to claim "RIAServices._" so that any RIAServices._ name is reserved for the RIA Services team.  We could create a convention where a name prefix can be claimed/reserved so that others cannot create a package.  Community contributions could still be named "RIAServicesFooBar," but "RIAServices.FooBar" would not be allowed because the product team owns "RIAServices." (with the dot)

3.4.3.855 (windows)

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem

1. Install mono. Download latest NuGet.exe. Run nuget commands to add sources:
`mono nuget.exe sources add -name FEED_NAME -source <feed url> -user <username> -pass "<password>"`

2. Try to run `mono nuget.exe list -source FEED_NAME`
Response is 401 and thus prompts for username/password. All credentials fail.

...

## Other suggested things
 - Did the same with `apt package` with the exact same results
 - Did the exact same thing on windows. I still got the prompt, but after manually entering creds, it would list packages (success).
 - Windows case is odd because the creds should be stored and sent up automatically. Linux case is odd because the creds are known to be working but always fail.
 - Using MyGet enterprise account

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Search v3 is missing the publish date" (#6875) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
The current v3 search endpoint does not return the `published` field for the package. Only the package metadata endpoint returns that. 

Having the date returned on search adds value when displaying search results. Please add `published` to that endpoint. The interfaces already support it if present.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Enhancements for NuGet assets location overriding via BaseIntermediateOutputPath and MsBuildExtensionsPath" (#6644) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
- [ ] We will consider a warning if  `MSBuildProjectsExtensionsPath` and `BaseIntermediateOutputPath` are not equivalent. Consider non-NuGet restore scenarios (meaning only do it in PR potentially)

- [ ] Consider an error if someone is building with RestoreOutputPath set (or using RestoreOutputPath in a restore for build). Consider how dotnet self-contained publish scenarios might affect this. 

- [ ] Change the UWP/csproj PR build tasks to reflect this. 

- [ ] Consider cross-versions complications (From the brainstorming me, the only sideeffect will be that the targets and props will now be imported, thus fixing a  bug, and if someone is using cross-versions in their CI/VS, they'll get the assets file in an unexpected folder)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Nusec - documentation / readme url" (#6873) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

When uploading a package to nuget.org manually via the website, I can set a documentation URL that points to a readme file on githig, as shown here: https://www.nuget.org/packages/DotNet.Glob/2.0.2

How do I this via a `nuspec` file, as I use CI / CD to publish my packages and so I don't want this to be a manual step. Is there some attribute in the nuspec for this?

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "IVsPackageInstallerProjectEvents/IVsPackageInstallerEvents events not raised with PackageReference" (#6872) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem

1. Create a VSIX that registers the `IVsPackageInstallerProjectEvents` and `IVsPackageInstallerEvents`
2. Start Visual Studio with this VSIX loaded
3. Create a new solution
4. Create a new project
5. Add a NuGet reference as packages.config => Events are raised
6. Create a new project
7. Add a NuGet reference as PackageReference => Events are not raised

Code of the extension: [VSIXProject1.zip](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/files/1955574/VSIXProject1.zip)

Question: Is there a way to be notified when a PackageReference is added/removed using the NuGet UI?

## Details about Problem

NuGet product used:
VSIX in VS 2017

VS version (if appropriate): 
15.6.7

OS version (i.e. win10 v1607 (14393.321)):
Windows 10 v1607 14393.2125

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "NuGet - Signing - Timestamp URL can not be https:// ?" (#6871) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
While trying out some of the signing features in the latest NuGet SDK packages, it seems it is not possible to use `https://www.freetsa.org/tsr` as a timestamper?

https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/blob/53734d0e377ec1bce8a29dba65a715dd2dd7e17c/src/NuGet.Core/NuGet.Packaging/Signing/Timestamp/Rfc3161TimestampRequest.cs#L189 seems to allow only `http://` - is this by design?

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Install-Package should filter unlisted packages when no version is given" (#5069) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
@jsakamoto commented on [Wed Apr 19 2017](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/3802)

### What you were trying to do.

Update the NuGet package "Selenium.WebDriver.MicrosoftWebDriver" from version v.10.0.14393.1 to latest version.

### What you expected to happen.

The version of the NuGet package "Selenium.WebDriver.MicrosoftWebDriver" update to v.10.0.15063.0.

### What actually happened.

The version of the NuGet package "Selenium.WebDriver.MicrosoftWebDriver" updated to v.10.1.14393.0.

That version is unlisted package version.  
See also: https://www.nuget.org/packages/Selenium.WebDriver.MicrosoftWebDriver/10.1.14393

### Steps to reproduce the problem.

1. Create or open any .NET project with Visual Studio 2017. 
2. Execute "Install-Package Selenium.WebDriver.MicrosoftWebDriver" command at Package Manager Console. 
3. After it, the correct latest version "10.0.15063" was installed. (This is correct behavior) 
4. Next step, execute "Update-Package Selenium.WebDriver.MicrosoftWebDriver" command. 
5. Then, the command update the package to UNLISTED version "10.1.14393" !

### Appendix Information

I guess, this problem happens due to the JSON response from api.nuget.org.

The JSON reponse contains "upper" proprty, but it looks like include unlisted package versions.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/95908/25183534/d08fa9a4-2552-11e7-8f4e-204207486981.png)

Is it by design and it should not change? or should fix it?

---

@skofman1 commented on [Wed Apr 19 2017](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/3802#issuecomment-295411222)

@joelverhagen , @emgarten , is this a client or server issue?

---

@emgarten commented on [Wed Apr 19 2017](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/3802#issuecomment-295439707)

Looks like a client issue if the unlisted package is being installed. The upper and lower bounds are correct.

---

@joelverhagen commented on [Wed Apr 19 2017](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/3802#issuecomment-295440372)

I confirmed this behavior in NuGet 4.2.0.2451 with a packages.config project. A PackageReference project does not reproduce the problem. The issue occurs for both V2 and V3 NuGet.org source URL.

As @emgarten, this seems to be a client issue.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "restore and build should not be needed when using dotnet.exe to pack nuspec" (#6866) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
currently if using dotnet.exe to pack a nuspec file (via a csproj property), you need to set IncludeBuildOutput=false if you use the --no-build switch. The project also needs to have been restored.

When packing via a nuspec file, both of these things shouldn't be needed.

CC: @jaredpar

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Deprecation of www.nuget.org/nuget.exe" (#20) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
|Spec wiki|Discussion issue|
|----------|------------------|
|*None*|https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/5381|

We are deprecating the use of URL: **www.nuget.org/nuget.exe** which currently downloads nuget.exe version 2.8.6. If you have a dependency on this URL, we recommend you to start using **https://dist.nuget.org/win-x86-commandline/v2.8.6/nuget.exe**. 

For consistency, we are also changing this endpoint to redirect to dist.nuget.org, which is our primary home for downloading all released versions of nuget.exe. 

**Old redirect:** https://az320820.vo.msecnd.net/downloads/nuget.exe 
**New redirect:** https://dist.nuget.org/win-x86-commandline/v2.8.6/nuget.exe

If you are interested in downloading newer versions of nuget.exe, please see the [Downloads](https://www.nuget.org/downloads) page on nuget.org.

For other methods of installing our client tools, please see our [Installing NuGet client tool](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/nuget/install-nuget-client-tools) documentation.

**Note:** There is no immediate plan to remove the URL **www.nuget.org/nuget.exe** . We will monitor the usage before taking it offline. We will also reach out again before taking the URL offline.
